6ca7f044-225d-4ecc-98d0-55dd1b4a5c5c.description: Cranfield University is a UK specialist postgraduate institution specialising in Leadership and Management; Defence and Security; Aerospace, Transport and Manufacturing; Water, Environment and Energy.
6ca7f044-225d-4ecc-98d0-55dd1b4a5c5c.name: Referencing and Plagiarism

badge_template_activities.title: This course was studied online as self-directed learning in non timetabled student time. The online learning may have been supplemented by a combination of timetabled workshops, tutorials and peer learning sessions. Although students will be signposted to the course at appropriate stages of the taught and research phases it is also available for on-demand learning and to be revisited at any time.

At multiple points in the online module there are learning activities to check understanding and the ability to apply learning. This must be successfully demonstrated to progress through the module. Successful completion may be a mandatory requirement as part of some taught and research programmes.

The course covers the role and importance of citing bibliographic references, and how to incorporate the work of other authors into their work correctly without plagiarising. Referencing acknowledges material or ideas produced by others by giving the creator credit for their work. Applying this knowledge and skill in the student’s work will enable readers to evaluate their argument, obtain the original sources and demonstrate the student’s intellectual integrity.

6cef9edf-6b72-4a61-8944-d24ad72228ac.description: Cranfield University is a specialist postgraduate University that supports students develop as professionals and learn how to apply their expert knowledge and skills in a global economy. Earners of this badge have successfully demonstrated the relevant professional skills to meet the Cranfield Competency Framework for Industry standard. This includes Leadership, Communication & Relationships, Personal attributes and Business.
6cef9edf-6b72-4a61-8944-d24ad72228ac.name: Cranfield Competency Framework for Industry

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully completed Cranfield Competency Framework including all three stages: self evaluation for success, personal growth and development, and showcasing skills for industry.

skills.name: Ability To Build And Develop Professional Relationships

2c7c1183-d25f-41f2-ba57-b76a8abee2a2.description: Cranfield University is a specialist postgraduate institution. By studying the Cranfield University Pre-sessional English for Academic Purposes (EAP) course an international student has improved their academic English in the four key areas of reading, writing, listening and speaking to a level that meets the English language admission requirement of the University. At the same time students have gained an insight into academic life and global cultures before beginning their postgraduate study.
2c7c1183-d25f-41f2-ba57-b76a8abee2a2.name: English for Academic Purposes (Online)

badge_template_activities.title: This course was studied online as distance learning. The educational experience was of live small classes attended daily. These were then followed each day by self paced tasks (homework) that was completed alone or in groups. Individual and group tutorials took place regularly.

The pre-sessional course is assessed by a continual assessment method where students build a portfolio of weekly tasks and milestone assignments which are holistically assessed by the class tutors and reviewed by the Programme Director. This credential is issued to students who have achieved a Pass mark across the assessments.

be33b5d8-f26b-4b88-b99c-497616442725.description: Cranfield University is a specialist postgraduate institution. By studying the Cranfield University Pre-sessional English for Academic Purposes (EAP) course an international student has improved their academic English in the four key areas of reading, writing, listening and speaking to a level that meets the English language admission requirement of the University. At the same time students have gained an insight into academic life and global cultures before beginning their postgraduate study.
be33b5d8-f26b-4b88-b99c-497616442725.name: English for Academic Purposes

badge_template_activities.title: This course was studied on-campus by face to face learning. The educational experience was of live small classes attended daily. These were then followed each day by self paced tasks (homework) that was completed alone or in groups. Individual and group tutorials took place regularly.

The pre-sessional course is assessed by a continual assessment method where students build a portfolio of weekly tasks and milestone assignments which are holistically assessed by the class tutors and reviewed by the Programme Director. This credential is issued to students who have achieved a Pass mark across the assessments.

fe553ee7-5194-47a3-a07a-ffa6e0c0acf4.description: The Cranfield Business Growth Programme (BGP) is the longest established executive programme specifically designed for owner-managers and entrepreneurs to help them develop a growth plan for their business. The BGP has had more than 3,000 participants from a wide range of sectors over the last 30 years.
fe553ee7-5194-47a3-a07a-ffa6e0c0acf4.name: Cranfield Business Growth Programme

badge_template_activities.title: Particpants develop a growth plan for their business during the duration of the programme and present it to a panel of industry experts.

skills.name: Assessing the Quality of a Business Plan
Building Core Competencies as an Organisational Leader
Developing a Growth Plan for an Organisation
Understanding the Internal and External Drivers of an Entrepreneurial Venture

4130b460-f503-49b9-8b50-a818f15baa8f.description: The Innovation Sprint is a structured process to identify organisational business problems, test ideas and prototypes over several weeks with a hands-on Hot-house experience applicable across a diverse range of problems and sectors. Participants have an opportunity to undertake strategic projects designed to add value to your organisation’s brand, integrating existing experience and capabilities, knowledge and skills acquired during the Hot-house applying them to their own organisational context
4130b460-f503-49b9-8b50-a818f15baa8f.name: Cranfield Innovation Challenge Sprint

badge_template_activities.title: Particpants develop a business plan for their organisation during the duration of the programme and present it to their Executive Leadership team.

Participants attend a two day intense, hands-on Hot-House that is applied across a diverse range of problems from productivity, strategy, to EDI.​ During these sessions they follow a structured step-by-step process to identify key organisational business problems and test ideas and prototypes through a series of innovation exercises and activities.

skills.name: Articulate Key Management Principles in Innovation of Products, Services and Business Models

6094d41c-9a36-49fc-8dda-49b35fcf746d.description: Knowledge of foreign languages plays a vital part in promoting communication, successfully establishing contacts in the international marketplace, and enhancing career opportunities. Alongside some management programmes students have the opportunity to acquire a working knowledge of a second commercially useful language. Focusing on spoken rather than written skills, languages are offered at the Foundation level in Business French or Business Spanish.
6094d41c-9a36-49fc-8dda-49b35fcf746d.name: European language skills for Business

badge_template_activities.title: Languages were offered at Beginners or Intermediate level in Business French and Business Spanish. The focus was on spoken rather than written skills and by the end of the course students will have reached a level that will allow them to understand and be able to hold simple conversations with a business edge. Languages classes were scheduled from January to May, on-line. Students attended for two hours per week for 20 weeks in virtual classrooms, in their evenings, plus informal peer practice.

Only students with an attendance record of more than 70% were eligible for assessment. The Language modules are assessed by online exams that can include Listening, Reading and Oral assessment. This credential is issued to students who have achieved both required attendance and a Pass mark in the assessments.

bbb283bd-a43b-4558-ae41-7416c1284554.description: Essential Management provides the senior team with the key tools needed to effectively manage functional departments and resources within SMEs. During the programme, participants identify opportunities and develop a commercially-driven business case that will contribute to the business strategy.
bbb283bd-a43b-4558-ae41-7416c1284554.name: Cranfield Essential Management Programme

badge_template_activities.title: Participants will identify opportunities and develop a commercially-driven business case that will contribute to the business strategy. This will be presented to Programme Leaders and other participants.

skills.name: Develop a commercially-driven business case that will contribute to the business strategy
Enhanced understanding of the core elements of management for small-medium businesses
Understand cash & profit and the essential difference

dba70bc3-d9c6-43de-a397-2ad174e209ff.description: Cranfield University is a specialist postgraduate institution. By studying the Cranfield University Pre-sessional English for Academic Purposes (EAP) course an international student has improved their academic English in the four key areas of reading, writing, listening and speaking to a level that meets the English language admission requirement of the University. At the same time students have gained an insight into academic life and global cultures before beginning their postgraduate study.
dba70bc3-d9c6-43de-a397-2ad174e209ff.name: English for Academic Purposes (Hybrid)

badge_template_activities.title: This 20 week course was studied in a hybrid manner. The initial 10 week period was completed via online distance learning. After a travel break the final 10 week period was completed on-campus by face to face learning.  The educational experience throughout was of live small classes attended daily. These were then followed each day by self paced tasks (homework) that was completed alone or in groups. Individual and group tutorials took place regularly.

The pre-sessional course is assessed by a continual assessment method where students build a portfolio of weekly tasks and milestone assignments which are holistically assessed by the class tutors and reviewed by the Programme Director. This credential is issued to students who have achieved a Pass mark across the assessments.

42b4fe05-cddc-44ab-a257-cf403660292f.description: Sales Management for Growing Businesses gives you the tools to build and create a sales function that is strategically directed and controlled. You will gain a fundamental knowledge of the tactics that must be employed on a daily basis to succeed in the field of sales.
42b4fe05-cddc-44ab-a257-cf403660292f.name: Cranfield Sales Management for Growing Businesses

badge_template_activities.title: Produce a review of your Sales Budget Plan and present to the Programme Leader and fellow delegates

skills.name: Improve practical skills in growing sales profitably
Increased understanding of client base and how to maximise sales on key accounts
In-depth understanding of your sales organisation and it's approach

af901f91-1c2f-482d-889d-95e0f0a807b4.description: This foundational module on Making Sense of the Economy is the first of three levels, that provide learning up to Masters level. It introduces key concepts that explain how an economy works and what policies are available to governments to manage an economy based on the objectives they are trying to achieve.
af901f91-1c2f-482d-889d-95e0f0a807b4.name: Making Sense of the Economy - Bronze

badge_template_activities.title: Learners complete activities for each of the skills described. To gain the Bronze badge learners complete all content and then research the key indicators for a national economy. Based on their analysis they submit a report for their organisation's management to help them plan for the economic outlook.

skills.name: Analyse the drivers of economic activity and growth in a national economy
Analyse the policy tools used by governments and central banks including fiscal, monetary, supply-side, international trade and exchange rate policies.
Debate the potential for trade-offs with respect to economic objectives and economic management;
Evaluate the importance of macroeconomic data and economic forecasts of relevance to public and private sector managers;

f2ce1088-56b4-4e10-bbdc-f53cd5f2b57e.description: This Bronze module on Transformational Strategy is the first of three levels that provides learning up to Masters level. The module provides an overview of a number of diagnostic frameworks related to transformational strategy. It supports the learning of how to apply these frameworks via a series of case studies at organisational and sectoral level.
f2ce1088-56b4-4e10-bbdc-f53cd5f2b57e.name: Transformational Strategy - Bronze

badge_template_activities.title: Learners complete activities for each of the skills described. To gain the Bronze badge learners complete all content and submit a summary of main challenges experienced in a nominated organisation and the number one priority (with rationale) to address, drawing on models covered.

skills.name: Appraise how effective Incremental and Transformational Strategy has been implemented within your own work experience or as a Customer.
Compare the differences and analyse the complexities of change within real-world experiences of those involved in organisational change from different perspectives
Critically evaluate different frameworks for guiding the implementation of transformational strategy such as the Kubler-Ross and 7S models
Define incremental change and both the limitations and drivers of this approach within case studies examining different industries.

0dcc7109-c9d6-4ba7-8ea9-dacd6839e34f.description: This foundational module on Leadership is the first of three levels, that provides learning up to Masters level. Learners explore different ways in which leadership can be understood and how these different perspectives apply to their own leadership approach.
0dcc7109-c9d6-4ba7-8ea9-dacd6839e34f.name: Leadership - Bronze

badge_template_activities.title: Learners complete activities for each of the skills described. To gain the Bronze badge learners submit a reflection on their previous views of leadership and how their views have changed as a result of their learning. Learners reflect on a previous leadership challenge and consider how they would respond to this differently now.

skills.name: Compare different traditional and contemporary leadership paradigms and assess their relevance for current organisational challenges.
Critically examine your leadership journey and begin to form a personalised learning framework for development.
Critique the advancement of leadership thinking over time and describe how leadership theories and models are shaped by context.
Describe and appraise paradigms, theories and concepts of leadership and their application in organisations.
Self-assess your leadership qualities, styles, and practices.

553b07ed-927f-44c1-b645-90f35aa85f44.description: The Studying with Impact course is online self-directed learning as part of Cranfield's Global Online Stackable Programme. The course provides our learners with a well-rounded skill set to help them study more effectively and progress in their academic studies. It enables learners to gain the necessary transferable skills sought by industry and employers by developing their personal and professional skills.
553b07ed-927f-44c1-b645-90f35aa85f44.name: Developing learning skills for impact

badge_template_activities.title: This online self-directed Studying for Impact course enables the learner to develop impactful skills which support the learning in the timetabled workshops, tutorials and peer learning sessions in the Bronze and Silver Global Online Stackable modules.

Employers need students empowered with skills like critical thinking, effective communication, resilience and independent thinking, among others. The module helps learners enhance their research, writing and personal development skills to enable them to study more effectively towards a resilient and rewarding future.

At multiple points in the online module there are learning activities to check understanding and the ability to apply learning. This must be successfully demonstrated to progress towards the Postgraduate award.

657fc5cc-23ee-4d41-ad15-7bb6c44174a5.description: This Silver module on Making Sense of the Economy is the second of three levels, that provide learning up to Masters level. This Silver module explores how governments seek to manage a range of macroeconomic issues associated with government financing, inflation, unemployment, and international trade. It reviews the impact of fluctuations in economic activity giving rise to the so-called business cycles and explores the causes of economic growth and the implications for economic policy.
657fc5cc-23ee-4d41-ad15-7bb6c44174a5.name: Making Sense of the Economy - Silver

badge_template_activities.title: Learners complete activities for each of the skills described. To gain the Silver badge learners complete all content and then submit their reflections on what advice they would offer a government that is currently experiencing a deep recession and inflationary pressures. They outline solutions for managing inflation and creating sustainable growth opportunities

skills.name: Analyse and evaluate the role and consequences of government deficit financing policy on individuals and the economy.
Analyse the economic and social consequences of unemployment and the policy implications.
Critically analyse economic growth theories and evaluate the implications for government policy.
Critically analyse the causes of business cycles and the policy options available to governments with respect to the stabilisation of the cycles.
Evaluate how governments attempt to correct international trade imbalances.
Evaluate the consequences and cures for inflation and the link with unemployment.

83aca489-2150-49ec-acde-70a36767518f.description: This foundational module on Organisational Behaviour is the first of three levels, that provides learning up to Masters level. It introduces key concepts of individual differences such as personality and multiple intelligences. It explores groups and teams in organisations, team roles and factors contributing to team effectiveness. The module provides practical tools, techniques, and tips that can be applied in day-to-day context and help to enhance leadership and business practice.
83aca489-2150-49ec-acde-70a36767518f.name: Organisational Behaviour - Bronze

badge_template_activities.title: Learners complete activities for each of the skills described. To gain the Bronze badge learners complete all content and submit an analysis of the organisational culture of an organisation they know.

skills.name: Appraise how organisational culture can be managed to improve business performance.
Critique how effective teams can be formed and managed in face-to-face and virtual business contexts.
Know what Organisational behaviour is, and judge the value of OB as a body of knowledge that, when applied, can result in improved performance and competitive advantage.
Value how recognising differences (in, for example, multiple intelligences and personality) and the use of reliable inventories can improve peoples’ satisfaction and performance at work.

5ceac3d8-3a03-4778-a3c0-3a3697f7cb9c.description: This foundational module on Financial Management is the first of three levels, that provide learning up to Masters level. Learners are introduced to the different legal forms a business can take and how this affects the way business is managed. They will also learn about different financing options for businesses and understand how the financial market functions to enable businesses to access finance.
5ceac3d8-3a03-4778-a3c0-3a3697f7cb9c.name: Introduction to Financial Management - Bronze

badge_template_activities.title: Learners complete activities for each of the skills described. To gain the Bronze badge learners complete all content and submit an analysis on the benefits of incorporation and different financing options for an example company.

skills.name: Critically assess the objectives of financial management in an organisation and recognise the role of financial manager within this context.
Describe legal forms of business organisations and investigate issues arising from ownership-management separation in companies.
Discuss the role of financial markets and institutions and how companies operate within the financial markets.
Evaluate capital options for different business types.

34f8b192-5cc4-4082-9fba-edaba78dddd4.description: This Silver module on Financial Management is the second of three levels, that provide learning up to Masters level. The module introduces the three key financial statements and explains how financial ratios can be used to assess a company's operational efficiency, liquidity and profitability. An explanation and application of the concept of time value of money gives learners the skill to analyse important financial decisions, whether personal, or corporate decisions.
34f8b192-5cc4-4082-9fba-edaba78dddd4.name: Introduction to Financial Management - Silver

badge_template_activities.title: Learners complete activities for each of the skills described. To gain the Silver badge learners calculate the financial ratios for an example company relating to its operational efficiency, liquidity, profitability and long-term financial health. They evaluate the company’s performance based on a comparison of two consecutive years In addition they compare the ratios of the example company with industry averages and comment on the overall performance of the company.

skills.name: Analyse the profitability and financial health of a company using a comprehensive set of financial ratios.
Apply fundamental concepts of time value of money to calculate future and present values.
Appraise key financial statements of a company and interpret the information within them.
Evaluate the importance of time value of money concepts for personal and corporate financial decisions.
Evaluate the operational efficiency and liquidity of a company using financial ratios.

cb57a556-9c8e-4a73-9e48-5226baa9d980.description: This Silver module on Organisational Behaviour is the second of three levels, that provide learning up to Masters level. In this module learners reflect on employee motivation and engagement and explore the impact and management of positive and negative emotions at work. They then review group dynamics and decision making and explore the impact national culture has on an organisation.
cb57a556-9c8e-4a73-9e48-5226baa9d980.name: Organisational Behaviour - Silver

badge_template_activities.title: Learners complete activities for each of the skills described. To gain the Silver badge learners keep and submit a learning log as part of their goal of becoming reflective practitioners. The learning logs allow learners to create “data” or reflections which will enable them to document their learning, engage with the content, and provide them with opportunities to explore new ways of behaving based upon these reflections.

skills.name: Analyse and apply understanding of group dynamics and decision making in complex situations.
Appraise the role of emotions in OB and that emotions can be positively managed to create resilient and high performing organisations.
Demonstrate how an evaluation of national cultural difference in behaviours can be applied to improve performance in domestic and global business contexts.
Investigate through appreciative inquiry and how it can be applied to create more productive organisations.
Value the development of motivational and engagement theories and their application in contemporary business settings.

9d711482-f923-43e4-9529-1c4d231822e9.description: This foundational module on Organisation Design is the first of three levels, that provide learning up to Masters level. It introduces three key organisation design models and uses case studies to support the transfer of theoretical knowledge into practical application. One of the models is discussed in more detail and learners apply the model to an analysis of their own organisation.
9d711482-f923-43e4-9529-1c4d231822e9.name: Organisation Design - Bronze

badge_template_activities.title: Learners complete activities for each of the skills described. To gain the Bronze badge learners complete all content and submit an analysis of their organisation's design using the Burke Litwin model. They review external, strategic and success factors and consider what is most critical to their organisation.

skills.name: Critically evaluate different models, frameworks and processes for OD
Design or adapt an appropriate organisation design based upon a modelled process
Evaluate the effectiveness and value of an organisation design

c2a0426e-60d8-4f86-8ba3-271fc47973d6.description: This Silver module on Leadership is the second of three levels, that provide learning up to Masters level. Learners explore how leadership is shaped by context and how this understanding is important to ensure leadership is effective. Learners identify their leadership development needs and develop an appreciation of the role of politics in leadership. They think about their own leadership identity before considering their current role and steps up to the next role.
c2a0426e-60d8-4f86-8ba3-271fc47973d6.name: Leadership - Silver

badge_template_activities.title: Learners complete activities for each of the skills described. To gain the Silver badge learners submit a report on their current stage in the 6 step leadership pipeline and how they have met the development demands for each of the steps they have identified as having already achieved. They then develop a step-by step plan for how they will achieve each the remaining steps they want to achieve.

skills.name: Apply the four paradigms on leadership (theoretical perspectives introduced in bronze) to your current and future organisational challenges.
Building on the self-assessment in bronze, critically appraise your current stage of leadership development and what your next stage of development looks like.
Contrast the different leadership practices required for technical and adaptive problems and appraise their relevance for contemporary organisational challenges.
Evaluate how to enact leadership practices in complex contexts.
Examine the leadership capability required in differing organisational contexts, cultural and international contexts.
Map your leadership network, and analyse the importance of power relationships, emotions, and political dynamics.

8044e220-9f1d-4e3d-ac61-37e461694866.description: This Silver module on Organisation Design is the second of three levels, that provide learning up to Masters level. Learners are introduced to the Mintzberg design parameters; review how changing external context might have influenced OD; discuss a number of more contemporary organisation designs, reflect on the relevance of agile approaches to OD in their organisation and consider constructs that are closely related to OD such as Organisation Development and Organisational Effectiveness.
8044e220-9f1d-4e3d-ac61-37e461694866.name: Organisation Design - Silver

badge_template_activities.title: Learners complete activities for each of the skills described. To gain the Silver badge learners complete all content and submit a reflection on how the organisational unit they are working in could be designed differently considering the PESTLE factors they have identified and identify at least one opportunity to enhance the outcome of a different design looking at Colin Mayer's Value Creation Theory and its six lenses.

skills.name: Analyse contextual changes impacting on organisation design
Analyse your stakeholder and cultural dynamics of the transition and apply approaches to manage this
Apply agile design approaches to an organisation
Compare and contrast traditional and contemporary approaches to organisation design
Understand and critically assess how digital transformation is impacting on organisation design

1e912059-bec3-4204-8507-373ac95deac1.description: This Silver module on Transformational Strategy is the second of three levels that provides learning up to Masters level. The module critiques the traditional view of strategy and reflects on the roles of leaders and middle managers in implementing transformational change.
1e912059-bec3-4204-8507-373ac95deac1.name: Transformational Strategy - Silver

badge_template_activities.title: Learners complete activities for each of the skills described. To gain the Silver badge learners complete all content and submit a detailed analysis of how a nominated organisation responds to change and provide recommendations of continued success within its market.

skills.name: Analysing how strategic ambidexterity, exploitation and exploration for new markets can assist organisations in the face of change.
Appraising the impact of disruptive change on organisations, with particular focus on technological disruptive innovations.
Assessing management contribution to successful execution of strategic change
Evaluating the traditional view of strategy as competitive advantage
Evaluating why traditional views are insufficient in protecting against transformational change
